column5: Echoing Lake Camp lays claim to being the most northern camp in Ontario. It was over 2 hours flying in a Caravan to get there from Sioux Lookout.  A cool perk is that there is a Beaver on floats at Echoing and the owner Shawn has boats cached on various lakes in the area.  We spent 4 nights at the camp and 3 nights at their Yelling Lake outpost.  I've been playing around with movie maker and put this together, it's a little cheesy.
Amazing Chris!  Does Echoing have all 3 species or were the lakers from yelling?  And did the lakes live up to their names?

Echoing has lakers, whitefish and pikes.  Yelling has lakers, pikes, eyes and brookies in the river but we were OOS for brookies.  When I was doing wolf howls after dark there was a haunting echo that lasted for a crazy long time. Not joking.
awesome - those fish that make the trips worth it. And looks like the weather gods smiled on you too
Heck of a trip and video. Well done!
Well done Chris  A real smorgasbord of species!!!!
Great video report Chris!  Tell your wife she did a good job, lol.
Huge gators and good job on the video dude.
Great video Chris !!! Looks like an amazing trip !
Great Stuff right there! That place look awesome!
